events.title: Epstein Files Motion to Seal Financial Disclosure
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein, through his attorneys, files a motion seeking leave to file his supplemental financial disclosure under seal, citing confidentiality under the Bail Reform Act and excessive media publicity.

locations: New York, NY 10019 (Law Office of Marc Fernich)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein had not yet provided a complete financial disclosure to the court, on advice of counsel, to ensure accuracy.
Epstein's motion argues that public filing of his financial statement would violate the Bail Reform Act's confidentiality requirement (18 U.S.C. ยง 3153(c)(1)).
The motion cites 'exceptional amount of publicity' about Epstein's finances as grounds for sealing the disclosure.
Three attorneys (Reid Weingarten, Martin G. Weinberg, Marc Allan Fernich) represented Epstein in this filing.
Judge Richard M. Berman of the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York endorsed the motion.
